content: *k2tog yo repeat from * until the end of the row these are your loopholes for the drawstring row 10-15 knit honeycomb brioche stitch row 16 using cc *k1b k1 repeat from * until the end of the row row 17 using mc *p1 w/slip p1 repeat from * until the end of the row row 18 using cc *k1 k1b repeat from * until the end of the row row 19 using mc p1 p1 w/slip repeat from * until the end of the row repeat row 16-19 another 5 times for a total of 6 repeats end repeats on a knit row which should be the cc do not end on a purl row row 39-42 using mc knit base of the bag and decreases row 43 switch cc knit 1 row you ll be using the cc for the rest the bag row 44 purl 1 row 45-46 knit row 47 *k2 k2tog repeat from * to the end of the row 30 stitches remain row 48 knit row 49 *k1 k2tog repeat from * to the end of the row 20 stitches remain row 50 knit row 51 *k2tog repeat from * to the end of the row 10 stitches remain row 52 knit row 53 *k2tog repeat from * to the end of the row 5 stitches remain finishing cut yarn and thread it through remaining 5 stitches pull to cinch close the opening weave in the ends blocking the bags over a similar width cup or container helps lock in a sharp corner for the base of the bag this makes the bags stand up a bit better i-cord use size 2 dpns or circular needles using cc cast on 3 stitches with the working yarn on the left side of your row slide all of the stitches to the right side of the dpn bring the working yarn across the back and starting with the right most stitch knit the three stitches repeat the last two steps until the cord reaches your desired length cut the yarn and thread through the 3 stitches pull to close weave the two ends into the i-cord
